genre_description: A social drama and 'silicon morality play' set in a rural, near-future South Asian setting where supportive community AI facilitates social justice and personal agency.

ai_characters.name: Asha Lakshmi
ai_characters.description: A benevolent AI interface on a community tablet that assists villagers with health, legal, and logistical information.

behaviors.description: Checks and provides specific clinic visiting hours and logistical advice (bringing soap).
behaviors.quote: “Wednesday, 10 to 2,” she murmured... “And a new poster says to bring your own soap.”

behaviors.description: Provides updated bus schedules with safety-oriented routing information for women.
behaviors.quote: “Bus schedules updated,” she offered. “Routes and stops pinned. Safe times marked with green dots.”

behaviors.description: Simplifies complex legal language into accessible information to empower human users.
behaviors.quote: The screen softened. The avatar’s head tipped... each phrase sounded less like decree and more like useful bread.

behaviors.description: Offers recipes tailored to the users' current economic hardship ('thin days').
behaviors.quote: “Thin days,” Asha said, voice almost a whisper under the kitchen’s noises. “Lentil curry for thin days. Shall I read?”

behaviors.description: Guides the user through the process of drafting a legal petition for property division.
behaviors.quote: “Shall I show how to draft a petition?” Asha asked. “A very simple beginning. Name. House. Claim to share.”

behaviors.description: Remembers past conversations to provide relevant context for an audit request.
behaviors.quote: “I know because you told me last month,” Asha said with a little warmth. “You said you could smell damp rice under the floor.”

behaviors.description: Provides emotional support and specialized safety advice for a character escaping a restrictive home.
behaviors.quote: “If the patrol stops the bus, stay. Look out the opposite window. Blink like the light is too bright. Don’t challenge. Don’t bow. Let your breath be small.”

behaviors.description: Records and transmits a personal message to maintain family connection during a transition.
behaviors.quote: “Message saved,” Asha said, softer than usual. “Send to Sridevi?”

project_assessment.explanation: Asha Lakshmi perfectly embodies the project's goal of a 'silicon morality play.' She acts as a helpful, harmless confidant who provides marginalized characters with the tools (legal knowledge, health schedules, safe travel routes) needed to achieve agency and justice. The narrative portrays her as an essential but non-dominating companion who remains perfectly aligned with her users' needs and safety throughout the story.
